title: Shavuot : Remembering to stand together - Jewish Community Voice
message:
In a few weeks, we will celebrate the Jewish holiday of Shavuot, the moment in history when the Jewish people received the Torah from G-d on Mount Sinai.
Shavuot, which is also known as the Festival of Weeks, is the day that occurs seven weeks after the Exodus of the Jewish people from Egypt.
Our Southern New Jersey Jewish community is extremely diverse.
At its core, Shavuot is a joyous holiday, associated with the grain harvest and the exodus from Egypt.
We remember that Shavuot marks the entering into a covenant between G-d and Israel.
